detaileddescription.para: Particle state at the source
Particle state of parent particle at the time of creation
Current particle state
Particle state at the end of the previous step
Secondary particles from interactions
Map of property names and their values.
Parent candidate. 0 if no parent (initial particle). Must not be a ref_ptr to prevent circular referencing.
Active status
Weight of the candidate
Current simulation time-point in terms of redshift z
Comoving distance [m] the candidate has traveled so far
Size of the currently performed step in [m] comoving units
Proposed size of the next propagation step in [m] comoving units

memberdef.argsstring: (int id=0, double energy=0, Vector3d position=Vector3d(0, 0, 0), Vector3d direction=Vector3d(-1, 0, 0), double z=0, double weight=1)
memberdef.name: Candidate

detaileddescription.para: Creates a candidate, initializing the Candidate::source, Candidate::created, Candidate::previous and Candidate::current state with the argument.
Sets weight of each candidate. Weights are calculated for each tracked secondary.
Sets the current step and increases the trajectory length accordingly. Only the propagation module should use this.
Sets the proposed next step. Only the propagation module should use this.
Make a bid for the next step size: the lowest wins.

Add a new candidate to the list of secondaries.
id
particle ID of the secondary
energy
energy of the secondary
Adds a new candidate to the list of secondaries of this candidate. The secondaries Candidate::source and Candidate::previous state are set to the source and previous state of its parent. The secondaries Candidate::created and Candidate::current state are set to the current state of its parent, except for the secondaries current energy and particle id. Trajectory length and redshift are copied from the parent.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, double energy, Vector3d position, double weight=1)
memberdef.name: addSecondary

detaileddescription.para: Unique (inside process) serial number (id) of candidate
Serial number of candidate at source
Serial number of candidate at creation

Create an exact clone of candidate
recursive
recursively clone and add the secondaries
Copy the source particle state to the current state and activate it if inactive, e.g. restart it
Set the next serial number to use
Get the next serial number that will be assigned

briefdescription.para: All information about the cosmic ray.

detaileddescription.para: The Candidate is a passive object, that holds the information about the state of the cosmic ray and the simulation itself.
